title: Reflections
heading: Where in cricket deep space will we walk now?
news: In many ways, fourth innings chases are cricket's final frontier in the game's mythos, its four-minute mile. What happens now that the barrier is being broken through?

title: Inside Story
heading: How will the IPL riches shape Indian cricket
news: The new media deal's potential as a game-changer has already been acknowledged, but what changes could it really usher?

title: Cricket & Climate Change
heading: Is Cricket prepared to weather the storm?
news: Whether we like it or not, climate change is happening and cricket is and will be affected. What is the sport's responsibility towards a global issue, and what can it do?

title: Think Tank
heading: What's going wrong for India overseas?
news: From winning in Australia and England to making a positive start in South Africa, India have now lost three overseas Tests on the bounce. Why has the tide turned?

title: Dialogue room
heading: Unravelling Nathan Lyon's evolution
news: Having sauntered his way into the top 10 all-time Test wicket-takers' list, Lyon opens up about his evolution as a bowler and as a person in the last 11 years

heading: What the IPL rights mean for the rest of the world
news: The IPL has become the second most valuable property in world sport, enriching the BCCI but leaving everyone else to wonder what downstream effects are on their way

title: Think Tank
heading: Piecing together the Pujara puzzle
news: For Cheteshwar Pujara, the last few years in international cricket have come with their high points but with diminishing returns. Former Protea analyst R Prasanna harks back to India's 2013 tour of South Africa, when he was in the opposition camp, and looks at what could have gone wrong for the batter in recent times

title: Dialogue Room
heading: Spin batting clinic with Steve Smith
news: In this exclusive interview, Australia's batting talisman deconstructs his art of playing spin, the technique, the tempo and more

title: Reflections
heading: The Imperial phase of Joe Root
news: Joe Root is a great player - we can say that now, and start to wonder just how far he might go

heading: Skidding away on the fast lane: England's injury distress
news: England have been experiencing an unprecedented slew of injuries to their best fast bowlers. What are the unique challenges that have contributed to this injury plague?

heading: Hard to hit: How Test specialists are turning over a new leaf in T20 bowling
news: The latest answer to counter batting domination was always right in front of our eyes. But why has it come to the forefront now?

heading: Live and Let Fly: Shane Bond's unforgettable club season in Cumbria
news: In the summer of 1999, the chairman of an out-of-luck club took a gamble on an unknown 23-year-old New Zealander, with spectacular results

heading: The Marcus behind 'Stoin'
news: The larger-than-life and fun-loving 'Stoin' or the sensitive and deep-thinking Marcus: which one's the real Marcus Stoinis? In a candid chat with Cricbuzz, the Australian all-rounder opens up on the "two different types of people" he is, the big role his father played in how he approaches life and cricket, and more

title: Dialogue Room
heading: Behind the scenes of Gujarat Titans' IPL win with Gary Kirsten
news: How a team that was short on "rockstars" overcame the odds with good leadership - from the owners down to the captain

heading: Kohli of 2018 vs 2022: What's changed with his technique
news: An illustrative and comparative assessment of what's changed in Virat Kohli's game and what could be going wrong for him in the last two and a half years, a period during which he hasn't hit an international hundred

title: Reflections
heading: Why a 74-match IPL is ripe for satire
news: The extended 2022 IPL has left everyone exhausted - except, that is, for the commercial arm. What are we to make of this exercise in late-stage capitalism as it feels more and more like a second division club competition?

title: Dialogue Room
heading: The Captain's journal ft. Faf du Plessis
news: He may be in the twilight of his career, but the respected South African is still finding meaning in cricket - largely through his journey of leadership. He speaks about his experiences with RCB this season in an exclusive interview

news: In an exclusive interview, Livingstone provides a peek into his six-hitting prowess, his uncluttered mind and his IPL experiences

heading: Why KKR have flattered to deceive
news: Having emerged strong out of the mega auction, KKR now sit seventh on the points table after losing seven of their 12 games thus far. And a spot in the Playoffs feel like a long haul away. R Prasanna looks into what's going wrong for the franchise this year

title: Reflections
heading: The Bull in winter
news: Warner's was a career born in T20. He was "the person thrown out there", the one who legitimised it by reverse-engineering a path to Test cricket

heading: 'I get excited to see express young bowlers like Umran Malik in IPL'

news: After having a middling day at the IPL auction, both GT and SRH have defied expectations and put on a series of impressive performances. We take a detailed look at how they are able to stand on their own against much stronger oppositions on paper

news: The five-time champions are winless in six games at the start of the season, an unprecedented situation for a team with an impeccable pedigree

heading: The Stephen Fleming way

news: Has Jos Buttler been lost to Test match cricket, or has he, at last, found his role as a preeminent white ball batter?

news: A five-year plan, fueled by a premature exit last World Cup, came to fruition as undefeated Australia clinched a record-extending seventh trophy with their characteristic fearless brand of cricket

news: With the tournament approaching the business end of the league stage, the subcontinental teams including India, have not used the legspinner as much as the others

news: Javeria Khan started her international career as an offspinner but has become Pakistan's most prolific ODI batter. She explains how a simple love for the game allowed her to have success in an unexpected discipline, and how she keeps improving.

heading: India at the World Cup: It's not always all about the numbers
news: The team's selection choices need a rethink, writes former India coach WV Raman

news: Everyone that met Shane Warne seems to have a story. Jon Hotten recalls an encounter in an old jumbo jet, and becoming one of the many who fell foul of 'Warnie spin'.

news: The coach of the India women's team until recently gives an insight into what could give India an edge in the Women's World Cup, 2022

news:

news: Recent developments suggest that the women's game can drive cricket's growth, as long as the administration of it can keep up with its potential

news: Much has been made of the increase in cricket data in recent years, but set against the example of baseball it has some significant blockages to genuine progress

news: As Richard Levi and Dewald Brevis cross paths in South Africa's domestic T20 tournament, what might SA's forgotten man have to share with its newest starlet?

news: Prasanna Agoram uses his extensive experience as an IPL team analyst to break down the methods to approach an auction

news: As the Under-19 World Cup gets into the business end, Paddy Upton casts an eye on the future and picks out an important step that could serve the next generation, and the game, well in the future

heading: Cricket's cosy coaches club: both a performance issue and a more sinister one
news: Speculation in England and Australia about potential new coaches has served as a reminder of how often the same names appear on both the international and franchise circuits, raising questions about their value - as well as a lack of diversity.
